trans-unit.target: TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_SEQ_00<tab>How many ways can a man die well? Corentiaux wishes to speak to you of this and more.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_SEQ_01<tab>House Fortemps has placed a reward on the heads of snow wolves responsible for attacks on the supply train. Though not even yearlings, the beasts are vicious and have a taste for man-flesh. Slay four wolves and skin them as proof of your deed.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_SEQ_02<tab>Where there were four wolves, there are now four pelts and a churn of red snow. You have scoured the blood from your hands, and are now ready to return to Corentiaux with the proof.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_SEQ_03<tab>Many in the High Houses prefer to leave problems unsolved rather than ask for assistance from adventurers─especially when the problem is a lowly predator and the prey is a lowly servant or ten. Corentiaux speaks of this with more than a trace of bitterness. Unusual it is for a knight, and possibly dangerous...
TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_TODO_00<tab>Collect hides from snow wolf pups.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_000<tab>A word, adventurer. House Fortemps has just called a reward on the snow wolves that harass our supply trains. These creatures are the most dangerous when young and starved, and this litter of four is both.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_001<tab>I lost two good men to these wolves. Had they been knights, the hunting horns would have sounded ere their blood had rusted! I would see you avenge them, and the reward is a fair one. Bring back the hides and we shall both gain what we seek.
TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_020<tab>From that smug look on your face, I should say there are four fewer wolves in Coerthas today. Show me the pelts and complete your triumph.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_100_020<tab>These are they, see you the markings here. With these hell-pups gone, all our people shall breathe easier. How near it is that we scorn death in the maws of a ravening beast! These men died in battle as surely as any on the dragon-pyre.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_021<tab>When knights are thin upon the ground, it is the lowly of the house who suffer─grooms and washers, porters and yeomen. Our house patches with adventurers whatever is threadbare, but...

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_022<tab>Some of the other High Houses continue to bar the gates against outlanders altogether, or treat them with such disdain that any service they accept must surely bear a taint.

TEXT_GAIUSB704_00899_CORENTIAUX_000_023<tab>Honor is in how justly we treat others who serve the cause alongside us, in life and death. Out of honor flows all that makes a man of a boy, a woman of a girl. Surely when we meet Halone in the afterlife, 'tis honor She judges, not pride.
